video_title: 3 startup ideas using data/trends to get you paid (steal these $300k/month ideas)

content_profile.title: 3 startup ideas using data/trends to get you paid (steal these $300k/month ideas)

key_takeaways: Solution: Use tools to analyze revenue data and identify underserved niches (Difficulty: intermediate)
Growth Tactic: Create LitRPG-specific newsletter to build flywheel (Channel: content)
Strategy: Create niche publishing house with value ladder
Strategy: Focus on Kindle Unlimited for niche categories vs publishing wide for new categories
Startup Opportunity: Professional LitRPG publishing house with full value ladder (Target: LitRPG readers, especially underserved female demo)

startup_ideas.title: Professional LitRPG publishing house with full value ladder
startup_ideas.target_market: LitRPG readers, especially underserved female demographic
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Low quality writing, poor covers, lack of professional branding in growing genre
startup_ideas.business_model: Kindle Unlimited royalties + newsletter + digital products + subscription backend
startup_ideas.validation: Books already doing $250k/month with low quality execution
startup_ideas.estimated_investment: $5-7k monthly for writers, $3-5k per cover, funding for professional elevation

startup_ideas.title: Female-oriented LitRPG with main character focus
startup_ideas.business_model: Kindle Unlimited + 100 book series + digital products + subscription
startup_ideas.validation: Identified gap in existing successful market
startup_ideas.estimated_investment: Similar to general LitRPG publishing house model

market_gaps.title: Finding supply-demand mismatches in publishing subcategories
market_gaps.solution_approach: Use tools to analyze revenue data and identify underserved niches

trend_opportunities.title: LitRPG genre catching fire
trend_opportunities.opportunity: Supply-demand mismatch with low-quality current offerings

trend_opportunities.title: Male readers wanting productive alternative to gaming
trend_opportunities.opportunity: LitRPG as 'male version of romance for females'
